Models¶

List of database models (MySQL & MongoDb) for form builder app.

class form_builder.models.BaseResponse(*args, **values)¶

Abstract mongoDb model to store response for a form.

Warning

This is only an abstract model. This does not map any collection.

Authors: Gagandeep Singh

class Answer(*args, **kwargs)¶

Response embedded document to an answer to the question in details. This includes various meta information for an answer.

Specifications for ``ai`` field:

{
    "<algo_key>":{
        "pending": true,
        "result": {

        }
    }
}

Points:

  • The structure is created during response creation after analyzing corresponding FormField.
  • All process looks for its algo_key to check if this answer must be analyzed or not. This happens when the process gets a green light to proceed after checking in response.process_flags.
  • If algo_key.pending is true, it means answer is yet to be procceed, so process it. Otherwise, if false, it means answer must have already been processed.
  • Results are store in algo_key.results mostly in form of json. Structure varies as per the algorithm result.

Authors: Gagandeep Singh

class BaseResponse.EndPointInformation(*args, **kwargs)¶

Response embedded document to capture various information about response end point. An end point is source from where the response originated. It can be a web client, a mobile hand-held device or any other device capable to generating response.

Warning

Do not change end point type enum. These are hardcoded in the device or web client scripts.

Authors: Gagandeep Singh

class BaseResponse.LocationInformation(*args, **kwargs)¶

Response embedded document to capture location information for a response

Authors: Gagandeep Singh

class BaseResponse.ProcessFlags(*args, **kwargs)¶

Response embedded document to log pending process that are yet to be applied on this response. Please note that this is not process logger. It simply specifies what process are still pending. Each process search for its key and uses its value to decide whether it must be applied on this response or not.

Warning

This document only contains pending process keys. When the process has been applied, it removes its key from this document.

Authors: Gagandeep Singh

class BaseResponse.ResponseFlags(*args, **kwargs)¶

Response embedded document to capture various types of flags related to the response.

Authors: Gagandeep Singh

class BaseResponse.SuspectReason(*args, **kwargs)¶

Response embedded document to record reasons for suspected response. Authors: Gagandeep Singh

class BaseResponse.UserInformation(*args, **kwargs)¶

Response embedded document to capture user information.

Authors: Gagandeep Singh

BaseResponse.get_answer_sheet_data()¶

Method to create answer sheet for this response for display. The order of the question is as per the order in the questionnaire.

Returns:JSON Answer sheet.

Answer sheet JSON format:

{
    "answers":[
        {
            "question_text": "<question text>",
            "answer": "<answer value>",
            "other_answer":{
                "question_text": "<question text>",
                "answer": "<answer value>",
            },
            "ai": {
            }
        },

    ],
    "obsolete_answers": [
        {
            "question_text": "<question text>",
            "answer": "<answer value>",
            "other_answer":{
                "question_text": "<question text>",
                "answer": "<answer value>",
            },
            "ai": {
            }
        },

    ],
    "constants": [
        {
            "question_text": "<question text>",
            "answer": "<answer value>",
        },

    ],
    "calculated_fields":[
        {
            "question_text": "<question text>",
            "answer": "<answer value>",
        },

    ]
}

Authors: Gagandeep Singh

BaseResponse.get_answers_lookup()¶

Method to get answer lookup dictionary that contains each answer information in detail. This uses response.list_answers to create lookup dict. :return: Lookup dict for format: { “<label>”: { <Answer embedded doc> } }

BaseResponse.get_duration_time()¶

Method to return duration in time format HH:MM:SS.

Authors: Gagandeep Singh

BaseResponse.save(*args, **kwargs)¶

Save method for a response.

Authors: Gagandeep Singh

BaseResponse.suspicion_add(type, text, user_id)¶

Method to add suspicion to this response. :param type: Type of suspicion :param text: text of suspicion

BaseResponse.suspicion_remove(reason_id)¶

Method to remove a suspicion reason.

Parameters:reason_id – Reason id to be removed
Returns:True if successful, False if id not found

Authors: Gagandeep Singh

class form_builder.models.Form(*args, **kwargs)¶

Model to define a form.

Authors: Gagandeep Singh

get_formquestions(only_current=True)¶

Method to return form questions for this form.

Parameters:only_current – If True, returns only those questions which are currently in the form. Otherwise returns all questions including those which have been changed.
Returns:List<form_builder.models.FormQuestion>

Authors: Gagandeep Singh

validate_form()¶

Validate form by analyzing schema, unique ids and various other necessary validations and return list id translation ids.

class form_builder.models.FormQuestion(*args, **kwargs)¶

Model to store all form questions(fields) irrespective of order or conditions. Thus, this model provides flat list of all fields used in the form.

Moreover, it also keeps a track of previous fields that have been either updated or removed. But this model cannot be used as audit trail since, it overrides fields to latest configurations if its label & data type class has not been changed.

Uniqueness:

form_id, label, field_class

Logic:

  • Before inserting new record, table it looked up form any previous record with key consisting of (form_id, label, field_class).
  • If found, this record is updated with new configurations settings.
  • If not found, new entry is made. Old one automatically get obsolete as there is new record with latest form_version.

Points:

  • To obtains list of all fields currently present in the form, query with key (form_id, form_version)
  • To obtains list of all fields that are or were in the form, query with form_id.

Authors: Gagandeep Singh

class form_builder.models.Theme(*args, **kwargs)¶

Defines a model for form theme. A theme consist of set of html templates for various components of the form such as base html, various field rendering htmls etc.

All template html files related to this theme must be kept under the directory /form_builder/templates/themes/[code]/

The structure of this directory is as follows:

  • /form_builder/templates/themes/[code]/

    • form_base.html

    • fields

      • html_text.html
      • html_numeric.html
      • html_<widget_name>.html # Refer ‘form_builder.widgets.py’
      • error_messages.html

All files under ‘fields’ directory must essentially define templates for every widget variable in form_builder.widgets.FieldWidgets

A Theme always has a skin with code ‘default’ which is created by this theme model post save in case it iss absent.

Authors: Gagandeep Singh

class form_builder.models.ThemeSkin(*args, **kwargs)¶

Defines a model for various skin of a form theme. A skin is essentially a variation in look and feel of the page and is mostly defined by css & images.

All css, js or image files must be kept under the directory /static/themes/[code]/ and must be implemented by form_base.html of that theme

By Default, a skin with code default is created for evert theme by ‘Theme’ model.

Authors: Gagandeep Singh

form_builder.models.iterate_form_fields(schema)¶

Global method to recursively iterate over fields in form schema.

Parameters:schema – Form schema
Returns:Field

Authors: Gagandeep Singh
